business.headline: India, US reschedule chief negotiators meeting on interim trade deal: ReportThe Indian team was earlier scheduled to start the three-day meeting on February 23 in the US. Joint Secretary in the Commerce Ministry, Darpan Jain, is the chief negotiator of India for this agreement.

JPMorgan concedes it closed Trump's accounts after January 6 attackUntil now, JPMorgan had never admitted that it closed Donald Trump's accounts in writing after January 6. The bank would only speak hypothetically about when the bank closes accounts and its reasons for closing accounts, citing bank privacy laws.

Trump hikes tariffs to 15% after court ruling, says US ripped off for decadesDonald Trump said the 150-day hike is legally permitted and that new "legally permissible" tariffs will be introduced during this period.

Old tax regime gets a boost. Does it work better for you than the new one?Handcrafted ByOur Editors If you have moved on to the new income tax regime, should you give the old one another look after the proposed benefits? Read on to see what the changes could mean for your tax savings.

India is catching up fast with US, China in AI race: IndiaAI CEO Abhishek SinghIn an exclusive interview following the Grand AI India Impact Summit, Abhishek Singh, CEO of India's Mission AI, discusses the nation's emerging role in the global artificial intelligence landscape.

Brazilian President Lula says India and Brazil can trade without relying on US dollarAs Brazil looks to deepen ties with India, Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva signals a future where the two economies trade more, rely less on the US dollar, and build a partnership driven by growth, technology and trust.

No debates within BRICS to create new currency: Brazil's Lula to India TodayIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva clarified there is no BRICS currency plan, but said India and Brazil can still rethink dollar-based trade and slowly build alternatives.

Can you open multiple PPF accounts? Here's the answerThe Public Provident Fund (PPF) is one of India's most trusted long-term savings options, thanks to its tax benefits, steady returns and government backing. Many investors, however, wonder if it's possible to open more than one PPF account to save more.

SIPs in crypto? What they are and how to get startedCrypto is often linked with sharp price swings and high risk. SIPs, on the other hand, are associated with steady, long-term investing. So what happens when these two very different ideas come together? That is where the conversation around crypto SIPs begins.

Exclusive: AI is like a tsunami hitting jobs market, warns IMF's chiefAccording to Georgieva, AI can boost growth and raise incomes. However, if not handled carefully, it can deepen inequality and unsettle workers.

Sensex ends over 300 points higher, Nifty gains despite market volatilityThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 316.57 points to end at 82,814.71, while the Nifty50 gained 116.90 points to settle at 25,571.25. Broader market indices also recovered well through the afternoon, lifting overall sentiment.

Gold jumps nearly Rs 1,000, silver surges Rs 4,000: Time to invest or wait for a dip?After several weeks of uncertainty, gold and silver are now moving higher with steady gains. This has boosted market sentiment, but it has also left many wondering whether to buy now or wait for more favourable prices.

How Hyderabad's love for biryani exposed a nationwide multi-crore tax scamIn India, biryani is more than food. It is an emotion that finally left a trail too big to hide. Read on to find out how it exposed a nationwide multi-crore tax scam.

8th Pay Commission: When will you get your arrears and salary hike?Central government employees and pensioners are closely watching every update on the 8th Pay Commission. The big questions remain, i.e., when will the new pay structure be implemented, and when will arrears actually reach your bank account?

IMF chief says India well-positioned in AI race thanks to digital infrastructureAccording to Kristalina Georgieva, India is in a strong position due to its early investment in digital public infrastructure, which now forms the base for wider AI access.

How a biryani billing trail exposed tax scam; Rs 70,000 crore sales hiddenWhat began as a simple I-T review of biryani restaurant bills turned into a sweeping hunt for Rs 70,000 crore in suppressed sales buried across the country.

Why has this Dutch company's stock gained over 90% on Nasdaq in six months?ASML Holding's stock has gained 94.66% in the past six months on the US stock exchange Nasdaq, where many of the world's biggest technology companies list their shares.

Infosys, Tech Mahindra, TCS: Why IT stocks are falling again todayThe slide in IT stocks raises fresh questions about what is spooking investors and how long this uneasy phase could last. A closer look may reveal more than the morning numbers suggest.

Sensex, Nifty open flat amid volatility, IT stocks continue to declineWith global cues expected to remain volatile, investors are likely to stay cautious. Movements in crude oil, the rupee and developments in the US–Iran standoff will remain key drivers for market direction through the day.

UK and India must shape AI together, says Kanishka NarayanIn an exclusive conversation with India Today, UK AI Minister Kanishka Narayan highlighted the strengthening technological partnership between India and the United Kingdom.

entertainment.headline: Amitabh Bachchan regrets missing Sunday meet at Jalsa, shares a note to fans Amitabh Bachchan skipped his Sunday meet with fans outside Jalsa. He expressed regret in a personal note and asked them to save energy for the future.

Samantha Ruth Prabhu has the same credo on praise and trolls. Read it here Samantha Ruth Prabhu opened up on handling social media negativity in a recent interaction with fans. She spoke about her perspective towards praise and trolls.

BAFTA 2026: Which female actors of Bollywood were presenters before Alia Bhatt? Alia Bhatt will debut as a presenter at the BAFTA Awards this year. Here are the female Bollywood stars who've presented before her. Also, check out when and where to watch the show live. We also look at Boong, the Manipuri film in contention this year, besides the celeb list expected.

Malaika Arora dating Harsh Mehta? Viral pic from Italy trip sparks buzz Malaika Arora is reportedly in a relationship with diamond merchant Harsh Mehta, and the two are said to have celebrated Valentine's week with a romantic getaway to Italy. A picture of the two from the trip has surfaced online.

Taapsee Pannu recalls embarrassing demands to wear padded bras in South films Taapsee Pannu opened up about certain uncomfortable realities female actors face at times in Southern cinema. She said filmmakers often make demands to cater to perceived audience fantasies.

Jai Hanuman: Rishab Shetty, Teja Sajja, Bhushan Kumar begin shoot with puja ceremony The upcoming film Jai Hanuman, starring Rishab Shetty, was launched today with a grand mahurat ceremony. The film is envisioned as a high-scale cinematic tribute to the revered deity Hanuman.

The Kerala Story 2 filmmaker is greedy, wants to divide people: Anurag Kashyap Anurag Kashyap recently slammed the makers of The Kerala Story 2 and called it a propaganda film. The film has attracted controversy similar to its predecessor, prompting court involvement and public debate over its themes and portrayal.

Dhurandhar 2 vs Toxic: RGV makes his choice, calls it a clash between two cultures Director Ram Gopal Varma reaffirmed support for Aditya Dhar's Dhurandhar and its sequel ahead of its highly anticipated box office clash with Yash's Toxic: A Fairytale for Grown-Ups.

Salsa legend Willie Colon dies at 75, family requests privacy in statement Grammy-nominated salsa musician Willie Colon died at the age of 75. His family confirmed his death in an official statement, asking for privacy as they mourn the huge loss.

Sudipto Sen's Charak faces censor hurdle, director ready to trim visuals Filmmaker Sudipto Sen recently revealed that his latest production, Charak, has been refused certification by the Central Board of Film Certification. Sen expressed complete uncertainty about the reason for the board's decision.

Do Deewane Seher Mein Box Office Day 2: Mrunal-Siddhant film earns Rs 3.42 crore Mrunal Thakur and Siddhant Chaturvedi's romantic drama Do Deewane Seher Mein recorded a rise in box office collections on its second day. The film earned Rs 1.60 crore on Saturday.

Eric Dane's girlfriend Janell Shirtcliff posts romantic photos in emotional tribute Actor Eric Dane's girlfriend, Janell Shirtcliff, paid tribute to him by sharing a collection of photos and videos of the couple. The heartfelt post offered a glimpse into their relationship following the actor's death.

Assi box office Day 2: Taapsee Pannu's film sees mild growth on Saturday Anubhav Sinha's latest film Assi, starring Taapsee Pannu, has shown a modest improvement on its second day. The Saturday collections brought the two-day total to Rs 2.60 crore.

Darkness redux: Anurag Kashyap is back on the neo-noir trail with Kennedy After over half a decade when he played the field with more mainstream subjects, Anurag Kashyap's new release, Kennedy, marks his return to exploring dark cinema.

Is Bigg Boss 19's Tanya Mittal getting married? New video sparks buzz Bigg Boss 19 contestant Tanya Mittal's recent bridal-themed social media posts have fuelled speculation about a possible wedding, leaving fans divided over whether the preparations are for a real event or another project.

Viral video: Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli back in Mumbai after Alibaug break Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli were clicked at Mumbai's Gateway of India ferry terminal as they returned from their Alibaug getaway. Videos of the two arriving at the ferry terminal have gone viral.

Scum of the world: Javed Akhtar condemns Taliban after new law permits wife beating Veteran lyricist and screenwriter Javed Akhtar has strongly criticised the new penal code introduced in Taliban-ruled Afghanistan that permits domestic violence against women. He raised concerns about the legal sanctioning of abuse and its far-reaching implications for women's safety and rights.

Hrithik Roshan's tribute to mentor MM Baig: You helped me find my way Hrithik Roshan has shared a heartfelt message following the death of his former teacher, MM Baig. He highlighted the impact Baig had on his early years as an actor.

Allu Arjun hosts cocktail bash ahead of Allu Sirish-Nayanika wedding. Guest list Allu Arjun's brother, Allu Sirish, is set to marry Nayanika Reddy on March 6. The wedding celebrations have officially begun with family members coming together for a special cocktail party.

general news.headline: Armed man tries to enter Trump's Mar-a-Lago resort, shot deadThe Secret Service said the man was seen near the resort's north gate carrying what appeared to be a shotgun and a fuel container, triggering an immediate armed response from security personnel.

IND vs SA Super 8 Live: India begin 188 chase in AhmedabadIndia (IND) vs South Africa (SA) Live Score, T20 World Cup Super 8: SA (187/7 in 20 ov). South Africa were 20 for 3 in the powerplay. David Miller and Dewald Brevis put on a 97-run stand to keep them out of trouble. Tristan Stubbs finished it off with a 20-run last over. Jasprit Bumrah was sensational with figures of 15/3 in 4 overs, but India will not be happy with that total. They could have limited South Africa to at least 10-15 fewer.

India loses another Tejas jet to suspected technical glitch, pilot ejects safelyUnder investigation, the Tejas fighter jet suffered severe damage during landing after a routine sortie, though the pilot ejected safely. The IAF has yet to issue an official statement.

Lashkar module's Bangladesh-based handler was in touch with Hafiz SaeedSources said that the Bangladesh-based handler of the eight suspects arrested today had been in direct contact with Lashkar's top leadership, including 26/11 Mumbai terror attack mastermind Hafiz Saeed.

Delhi's OG mall Ansal Plaza is now a ghost townHandcrafted ByOur Editors Not every generation might be able to relate to Ansal Plaza or its existence. But that doesn't change the fact that it was Delhi's OG mall. But today, its condition is as good as a ghost town.

After arrest, UK looks to remove ex-Prince Andrew from royal line of successionAndrew, 66, remains eighth in line to the throne despite having been stripped of his royal titles and stepping back from official duties.

Top Jaish commander among 3 terrorists killed in gunfight in J&K's KishtwarThree terrorists were killed in a gunfight with security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar. The operation was launched after intel about two-three terrorists hiding in Chatroo forest belt.

Trump says US sending hospital ship to Greenland, gets roasted onlineUS President Donald Trump's claim that Greenlanders were "not being taken care of" triggered a wave of criticism on social media, where users contrasted the island's universal healthcare with gaps in the US itself.

Gutter, but of gold. Why Dharavi slums charge Rs 5 lakh rent a monthThe towers of Mumbai have seen kilometres of expanse of Dharavi's asbestos and tin roofs for decades. Most pity the slums as a place that is deprived of the basics, while others romanticise them. As Asia's largest shanty town stands at the cusp of a major overhaul, it's humming with enterprise. Beyond the filth, Dharavi runs businesses that generate a billion dollars a year.

Treated like criminals: Indian vlogger detained in South Korea, China for 38 hoursIndian content creator Sachin Awasthi claimed that he was held for 38 hours in detention at Jeju Island, South Korea, and during transit through China. He shared his experience of being denied entry, facing strict supervision and limited communication.

Inside Epstein empire: Sex abuse and the billionaire boys' clubHe built a glittering empire of wealth and influence, and hid a machinery of abuse behind its gates. When the walls finally cracked, the fallout reached presidents, princes and billionaires who once moved freely through his world. But how did Jeffrey Epstein build, finance and shield one of the most notorious sex-trafficking networks in modern history? Here is a detailed look inside the evil empire.

Army dog leads troops to Jaish terrorists' hideout in J&K, injured in gunfightArmy dog Tyson ran ahead of the troops during the search operation in Kishtwar and successfully pinpointed the terrorists' location in the operation zone.

The Indian patent story: Why private universities file more patents than IITs combinedHandcrafted ByOur Editors India has crossed 1 lakh patent filings in 2024–25, with educational institutes driving a 62% surge in a year. Private universities dominate filings, overtaking the IITs. But are these patents signs of real innovation or ranking strategy? This deep dive breaks down patent filings vs patent grants, incentives, reimbursements, and commercial impact to uncover what is really behind India's university patent boom.

MS Dhoni unlikely to play all matches of IPL 2026: ReportMS Dhoni has confirmed his availability for the IPL 2026 season with Chennai Super Kings. However, his participation in all matches remains uncertain due to fitness and team strategy considerations.

Used global event for dirty politics: PM shreds Congress over shirtless protestPM Modi criticised the Congress over a shirtless protest staged by Youth Congress workers during the India AI Impact Summit at Bharat Mandapam. He accused the party of using a global platform for "dirty politics" and violating the decorum of a national event.

Telangana is their ATM: BJP on Revanth Reddy offering Rs 1,000 crore to GandhisReddy said that the Congress workers in Telangana could easily arrange Rs 1,000 crore for the Gandhi family if needed. He was slammed by both BRS and the BJP.

Hyderabad man's Ferrari 'malfunctions', rams multiple cars; several injuredA speeding Ferrari lost control, jumped onto the wrong side, and rammed multiple vehicles in Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills, injuring several people.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Temperatures to rise in North India from Monday, rain to drench SouthThe IMD predicts a warm Monday across North India. Delhi is set to reach 31 degrees Celsius tomorrow. Rain is also expected in parts of Odisha, Bengal, and Kerala.

IND vs SA Super 8: India continue to bench vice-captain Axar PatelIND vs SA, T20 World Cup: India once again left out vice-captain Axar Patel as the defending champions named an unchanged playing XI for their Super 8 clash against South Africa in Ahmedabad on Sunday, February 22.

Malaika Arora dating Harsh Mehta? Viral pic from Italy trip sparks buzzMalaika Arora is reportedly in a relationship with diamond merchant Harsh Mehta, and the two are said to have celebrated Valentine's week with a romantic getaway to Italy. A picture of the two from the trip has surfaced online.

2 sisters, set to get married on same day, die by suicide in JodhpurA relative has alleged family pressure behind the incident, while police have registered a case of unnatural death and launched an investigation.

Was critical of PM after Godhra, but Gujarat visit changed views: Bihar GovernorBihar Governor Arif Mohammed Khan said he had criticised then-chief minister of Gujarat Narendra Modi after the 2002 Godhra unrest but changed his view after spending over four months in Gujarat interacting with people from different communities.

No phones for children in Karnataka? Siddaramaiah flags social media addictionKarnataka is consulting university heads on restricting mobile phone use for students under 16, citing social media addiction concerns. Similar online safety measures for children are being explored in other states, including Goa and Andhra Pradesh.

sports.headline: MS Dhoni unlikely to play all matches of IPL 2026: Report MS Dhoni has confirmed his availability for the IPL 2026 season with Chennai Super Kings. However, his participation in all matches remains uncertain due to fitness and team strategy considerations.

IND vs SA Super 8: India continue to bench vice-captain Axar Patel IND vs SA, T20 World Cup: India once again left out vice-captain Axar Patel as the defending champions named an unchanged playing XI for their Super 8 clash against South Africa in Ahmedabad on Sunday, February 22.

Sri Lanka hand Harry Brook a birthday gift as England begin Super 8 with win T20 World Cup, SL vs ENG Super 8: Sri Lanka were bundled out for 95 in 16.4 overs as England's spinners ran riot, successfully defending a par total of 146. Will Jacks starred with his part-time off-spin, claiming three crucial wickets in Pallekele on Sunday.

Pakistan Super League: Sialkot Stallionz sold again ahead of new season The Sialkot Stallionz franchise in the Pakistan Super League has been sold again following disputes over ownership and financial background. The controversy raises questions about the PCB's vetting process ahead of the PSL 11 season.

India retain Women's Asia Cup Rising Stars title, beat Bangladesh again in final India A women's cricket team retained their ACC Women's Asia Cup Rising Stars crown after defeating Bangladesh A by 46 runs in the final held at the Terdthai Cricket Ground. The defending champions overcame early setbacks and relied on strong batting and disciplined bowling to secure victory.

IND vs SA Super 8 Live: Miserly Bumrah keeps Proteas quiet in end overs India (IND) vs South Africa (SA) Live Score, T20 World Cup Super 8: SA (167/7 in 18.5 ov). Jasprit Bumrah has swung the momentum in India's favour. He finishes with 3 for 15 in four overs. South Africa looked good for a 180-plus score, but they lost momentum in the end overs.

India loses six on the trot in FIH Pro League, suffers AUS shootout heartbreak India's horrible run in the FIH Pro League continued as they lost their sixth match on the trot on Sunday, February 22. Australia edge past the Indian team 5-4 in the penalty shoot-out in Hobart.

Indian-origin players global ambassadors of Indianness at T20 World Cup: PM Modi Many players of Indian origin are making their countries proud, reflecting the true spirit of being Indian, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Sunday. He added that wherever Indians go, they remain connected to their roots while contributing to the growth and development of the country they live and work in.

Abhishek Sharma's 3 ducks a positive: Shastri's stunning claim before IND vs SA T20 World Cup: Ravi Shastri feels that Abhishek Sharma's three ducks in the T20 World Cup 2026 is actually a good thing for India. Shastri feels that the other teams will be scared of the Indian opener knowing that he is due for runs.

Smriti Mandhana writes heartfelt note on Instagram after Australia T20I heroics Smriti Mandhana posted a cryptic message after her match-winning 82 in the T20I decider against Australia. The India opener stressed that performance, not emotions, ultimately defines success in sport.

Qatar in focus: Doha to host ICC board meetings in MarchDoha will host the next ICC board and committee meetings from March 25 to 27, reflecting Qatar's rapid cricket growth and increasing role in international cricket governance.

After Vini Jr., Fofana, Hannibal receive racial abuse after Chelsea-Burnley drawWesley Fofana and Hannibal Mejbri have been subjected to racial abuse following Chelsea's draw with Burnley in the Premier League. This happens days after Vinicius Jr was allegedly racially abused during the Real Madrid vs Benfica game.

SL vs ENG Super 8 Highlights: Jacks, Archer guide England to 51-run victorySri Lanka (SL) vs England (ENG), T20 World Cup Highlights: England have inflicted a massive 51-run loss on Sri Lanka as Will Jacks, Jofra Archer, Adil Rashid and Liam Dawson have run through their batting line up.

India vs South Africa: A cricket journey scripted as Tendulkar's travelogueAs India prepare to face South Africa in the T20 World Cup Super 8 in Ahmedabad, Sachin Tendulkar's career reminds us how one opponent shaped his journey through reunion, rivalry, scandal, accusation, redemption, and ultimate triumph.

Neymar hints at possible retirement at the end of 2026 season: Living year to yearNeymar has revealed he could retire at the end of the 2026 season but remains determined to play one final FIFA World Cup with Brazil. The 34-year-old says he is taking his career year by year.

India's spin power not a threat to South Africa: Neil McKenzie ahead of Super 8 clashT20 World Cup: Neil McKenzie believes India's spin attack will not automatically trouble South Africa in the Super 8 clash. The former Proteas batter feels match-ups and execution will matter more than variety in Ahmedabad.

Surya taking it a bit too far: Manjrekar calls IND captain's approach dangerousT20 World Cup: Ahead of India's clash against South Africa in the Super 8, Sanjay Manjrekar criticised Suryakumar Yadav's batting approach in the tournament so far. Suryakumar has adopted a cautious approach during the tournament.

From backyard rivalry to Ahmedabad: Morkel brothers ready for IND vs SA clashT20 World Cup: It may be India vs South Africa in Ahmedabad on Sunday, February 22, but the match will also feature two brothers on opposite camps. Albie and Morne Morkel open up about their backyard rivalry, job roles and more in a candid chat with the BCCI.

India, South Africa set for Super 8 showdown in 2024 final rematch  Live updatesT20 World Cup: India take on South Africa in their first Super 8 clash in the T20 World Cup. In Ahmedabad's cricketing circles, this is being billed as the toughest challenge for India yet in this World Cup.

Chasing Virat Kohli, losing themselves: Pakistan stars who faded awayPakistan has produced several cricketers, including Babar Azam, who were compared to Virat Kohli. While many made impressive starts to their careers, most struggled to demonstrate the level of consistency and dedication that Kohli has maintained over the years at the highest level of cricket.

Who will be biggest threat to Jasprit Bumrah vs South Africa? Varun Aaron revealsFormer cricketer Varun Aaron warns India about Aiden Markram ahead of their Super 8 T20 World Cup match. The contest in Ahmedabad could hinge on Markram's ability to counter Jasprit Bumrah's bowling, says Aaron.

Not slow and steady, India need the 2024 version of Tilak Varma in Super 8sT20 World Cup: India cruised through a manageable group stage, but the real test begins now. Against South Africa and tougher Super 8 opponents, Tilak Varma may need to rediscover his 2024 tempo, not just his anchor role.

India don't need changes vs South Africa: Sunil Gavaskar backs XI for Super 8 clashT20 World Cup: Sunil Gavaskar feels India should stick to their winning XI for the Super 8 clash against South Africa, with Washington Sundar the only possible tweak if Abhishek Sharma's struggles continue. Otherwise, he backs the side to handle the pressure.

Abhishek Sharma must show patience vs South Africa: Ex-India selector backs openerT20 World Cup: Three ducks in a row have put Abhishek Sharma under the spotlight ahead of India's Super 8 clash. Former selector Saba Karim believes patience, not panic, is the key to his revival.

The tale of two Indias: Surya offers rare glimpse into the team's other sideIND vs SA, T20 World Cup: Suryakumar Yadav's Indian team begin their Super 8 campaign against South Africa on Sunday. Here is a rare glimpse into a side of the Indian team that is often unseen, beyond their confident and bullish persona on the global stage. Observations in Ahmedabad, however, suggest a group that is far more grounded, introspective, and measured than their dominant image suggests.

SL vs ENG: Can Sri Lanka turn the tables on England who humbled them months ago?SL vs ENG, T20 World Cup 2026 Super 8s: Sri Lanka and England meet in the Super 8s with contrasting form, injury concerns and threatening rain clouds over Kandy making this one of the most unpredictable fixtures of the tournament.

T20 World Cup, IND vs SA Predicted XI: Will Kuldeep Yadav replace Arshdeep Singh?India will aim to continue their unbeaten run as they face South Africa in their first Super 8 fixture of the T20 World Cup 2026. The team management will have to make a choice between Kuldeep Yadav and Arshdeep Singh for the crucial encounter.

Is F1 returning to India? Adani Group reveals plans to revive Buddh CircuitKaran Adani confirms the Adani Group is working on plans to bring Formula 1 back to India's Buddh International Circuit, more than a decade after the last race was held there.

PAK vs NZ: Pakistan get lucky as rain wipes out Super 8 clash after toss blunderT20 World Cup 2026: Rain washed out Pakistan's Super 8 opener against New Zealand at R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo, sparing them after a surprising decision to bat first.

Abhishek must keep doing what he's doing, he's young and bound to fail: QuintonT20 World Cup IND vs SA: South Africa wicketkeeper batter Quinton de Kock threw his weight behind India opener Abhishek Sharma amid his poor form in the ongoing tournament. Abhishek is yet to score a run in the tournament, having registered three ducks so far.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
